com.samsung.android.sdk.cup

Class ScupWidgetBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.cup.ScupWidgetBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScupButton, ScupDatePicker, ScupGraph, ScupLabel, ScupListBox, ScupMediaController, ScupProgressBar, ScupSeparator, ScupSlider, ScupSpinner, ScupTextClock, ScupThumbnailListBox, ScupTimePicker

    public class ScupWidgetBase
extends Object
    This class represents a WidgetBase. ScupWidgetBase is the basic class for widgets, which are used to create interactive UI components(button, label, spinner, etc.).

      • FILL_DIALOG

        public static final int FILL_DIALOG
        Value for the width or height.
        FILL_DIALOG means the widget width or height should be as big to its dialog.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WRAP_CONTENT

        public static final int WRAP_CONTENT
        Value for the width or height.
        WRAP_CONTENT means the widget width or height should be fit its internal content.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys a ScupWidgetBase instance.
        It is called when the widget call its destroy() method.
        If the widget is shown on the screen, it should be hidden automatically.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If widget is already destroyed.

      • getId

        public short getId()
        Gets the instance id of this instance.
        Returns:
        Instance id. If this widget is not created yet or already finished, it returns 0.

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of widget.
        If width is positive value, it means the percentage of the screen width.
        For example, if you use setWidth(50), width of widget should be same with the half of screen width.
        Parameters:
        width - One of FILL_DIALOG or WRAP_CONTENT, or percentage of the screen width.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If width is less than 1 or bigger than 100.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of widget
        Returns:
        One of FILL_DIALOG or WRAP_CONTENT, or percentage of the screen width.

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of widget.
        If height is positive value, it means the percentage of the screen width.(NOT height)
        For example, if you use setHeight(50), height of widget should be same with the half of screen width.
        The reason of "NOT height" is because widget keep the aspect ratio.
        Parameters:
        height - One of FILL_DIALOG or WRAP_CONTENT, or percentage of the screen width (NOT height).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If height is less than 1 or bigger than 100.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height of widget
        Returns:
        One of FILL_DIALOG or WRAP_CONTENT, or percentage of the screen width (NOT height).

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(int color)
        Sets the background color of widget
        Parameters:
        color - The background color of widget
        See Also:
        getBackgroundColor()

      • getBackgroundColor

        public int getBackgroundColor()
        Gets the background color of widget
        Returns:
        The background color of widget
        See Also:
        setBackgroundColor(int)

      • setBackgroundImage

        public void setBackgroundImage(Bitmap bitmap)
        Set the background image to a given bitmap
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap to use as the background

      • setBackgroundImage

        public void setBackgroundImage(int resId)
        Set the background image to a given resource
        Parameters:
        resId - The identifier of the resource.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If resId is invalid.

      • show

        public void show()
        Display the widget.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Hide the widget.
